learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced level skills of assessment and treatment of the articular, muscular and neural system.
Demonstrate an understanding of risk management principles and ethical considerations in the safe and effective management of clients with sports injuries and musculoskeletal conditions.
Understand and explain the rationale for the selection of assessment and treatment techniques/plans for sports injuries and musculoskeletal conditions.
Understand and explain the evidence underpinning physiotherapy management to the client and the multi-discipinary health/sports team.
Review and synthesis the literature to understand and communicate underlying pathology, risk factors and management of common injuries among individuals who participate in sport and exercise.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess practical physiotherapy skills in a practical station exam.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess students understanding of course content in a case-based online written exam.

This assessment task is to be completed online.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The completed exam will be submitted via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a sport and deliver an individual oral presentation that presents their analysis of a fundamental skill or movement which is a key component of the sport (i.e., a tennis serve, volleyball spike, rugby tackle, the eggbeater kick in water polo, etc…), and discusses the management of a specific injury typically associated with the task.

The oral presentations will be delivered online.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 7(28 Jul - 14 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series)

Students will learn practical sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series)

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 7(28 Jul - 14 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Clinical seminar series)

Students will participate in interactive inter-professional discussions on a topics of relevance to sports and exercise medicine and physiotherapy.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Clinical seminar series)
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Sports  and Exercise Physiotherapy (Clinical seminar series) Students will participate in interactive inter-professional discussions on a topics of relevance to sports and exercise medicine and physiotherapy.

learning_activities.topic:
Sports Analysis Presentation Feedback Session

Staff will provide feedback on the progress of your sports analysis presentation. During this session you will receive feedback on your planning and development of your sports analysis presentation from staff and your peers. You are also expected to provide feedback to your peers on their planning and development of their presentations.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
